case_title: ABDUR RASHID vs INSPECTOR-GENERAL OF POLICE AND 2 OTHERS
court: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal

key_facts.initial_promotion: Promoted to Selection Grade Constable on 1966-02-16 and temporarily to Head Constable on 1973-01-04.
key_facts.reversion: Reverted to Constable on 1973-07-26 by Commandant A.K.P. Rangers.
key_facts.dismissal: Dismissed on 1974-04-15 for being absent without leave.
key_facts.reinstatement: Reinstated as Constable on 1974-10-12 due to procedural irregularities in dismissal.
key_facts.leave_dispute: Period of dismissal treated as leave without pay instead of furlough leave or leave on private affairs.
key_facts.promotion_restored: Reinstated as Selection Grade Constable on 1975-03-18 and later promoted temporarily to Head Constable on 1976-01-25.
key_facts.final_reversion: Reverted to Constable on 1977-03-24 following directions from Inspector-General of Police.

legal_issues: Failure to provide an opportunity to show cause before demotion, violating Police Rule 16.28(3).
Improper delegation of decision-making authority by Deputy Inspector-General to Inspector-General.

tribunal_findings.violation_of_rules: Demotion orders violated Police Rule 16.28(3) as no opportunity to show cause was provided.
tribunal_findings.improper_review: Deputy Inspector-General acted on directions from Inspector-General without exercising independent judgment.
tribunal_findings.leave_misclassification: Leave period should have been treated as furlough leave or leave on private affairs if due.

tribunal_decision.reinstatement: Appellant reinstated as Selection Grade Constable from the date of original promotion.
tribunal_decision.leave_adjustment: Period of absence to be treated as furlough leave or leave on private affairs if due.
